newsitem.title: CHINA: China closes 30 small car plants on over-supply.
newsitem.headline: China closes 30 small car plants on over-supply.

text.p: China has closed 30 vehicle plants in a crackdown on heavy over-supply in the industry, the Business News said on Thursday.

The plants, each with an annual capacity of less than 100 cars, have been ordered to merge with other major producers, apply for bankruptcy or shift their business to other fields, the newspaper said, quoting Zhang Xiaoyu, director of the vehicle industry department of the Machinery Ministry.
The newspaper did not name the plants.

China produced 1.5 million cars in 1996, an increase of 3.4 percent on the previous year, but car stocks have risen at a much greater rate, the newspaper quoted Zhang as saying. There were no further details on inventories.
Due to heavy over-supply, car prices are expected to fall around 10 percent in 1997 after sharp falls last year, the newspaper quoted Zhang as saying.
